page.title: 08Housing in Alford
page.content: A few years ago Gordon District Council relaxed their strict planning control to encourage rural repopulation. This along with a new sewage treatment works has led to a marked increase in housebuilding. Many new houses come in quickly erected kit form. The traditional house has a slate roof and is built of granite, some of Syllavethy granite from the now disused quarry. Many council houses have been sold to their tenants. Now approximately half the houses are privately owned and half rented. This year pensioners' houses were built and two years ago sheltered housing was completed. A warden is on call and church services, hairdressing chiropody and social activities are organised. This enables the elderly to stay in the community in comfort but with privacy if so desired.
